title: Steve Borthwick takes pride in Japan's emergence as World Cup force
text:
Steve Borthwick helped orchestrate Japan's 'miracle' win over South Africa four years ago and now he is savouring the hosts' emergence as a force at this World Cup.

England's forwards coach performed the same role with the Brave Blossoms at the 2015 tournament.

In response to their win over Scotland which clinched a quarter-final against the Springboks on Sunday, he said: 'I've still got friends who play in that team so I enjoyed watching the game as an interested spectator.

Steve Borthwick has enjoyed watching Japan's emergence as a force this World Cup

'It's great for the tournament that the host nation are still involved at this stage. There is excitement around the country.

The TV figures are record breaking, which is brilliant. To have so many people watching the sport here is fantastic and hopefully it will inspire even more people to get involved.

'Japan have earned their place in the quarter-finals and they've got a very good coaching staff. They are very smart and astute and they've found ways to be successful.'
